docs.snippet: It’s planning to end net neutrality while opposing the Time Warner and AT&T merger. This doesn’t make sense.

headline.print_headline: The Trump Administration’s Incoherent Stance on Competition
headline.main: The Trump Administration’s Incoherent Stance on Competition

docs.snippet: Executives of Facebook, Twitter and Google faced questioning this week on Capitol Hill about Russia’s intrusions. But that is only a small fraction of the fraud on social media.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Says It’s Policing Fake Accounts. So Why Are They Still Easy to Spot?
headline.main: Facebook Says It’s Policing Fake Accounts. But They’re Still Easy to Spot.

docs.snippet: The office search indicates the company is growing more positive about its prospects in mainland China, where it has been unavailable for nearly a decade.

headline.print_headline: Facebook, Despite Ban, Seeks Foothold in China
headline.main: Blocked in China, Facebook Is Said to Seek a Shanghai Office

docs.snippet: The Times concluded that “Melvin Redick” on Facebook was a fake American created by Russia as part of its propaganda campaign. But where did the man’s photos come from?

headline.print_headline: Tracing Photos in Fake Facebook Profile
headline.main: Mystery of Russian Fake on Facebook Solved, by a Brazilian

docs.snippet: Facebook rewards catchiness, and the unique nature of the social network’s ads may have aided Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election.

headline.print_headline: Blurring Lines: How the Ad System on Your Facebook News Feed Works

docs.snippet: The president asserts that the “Fake News Media” had the most sway in the 2016 election, and he again denies any Russian role in the campaign.

headline.main: Trump Dismisses ‘Russia Hoax’ as Facebook Turns Over Ads Tied to Campaign

docs.snippet: Amid a series of scandals and sins, a few righteous tech innovators actually brought positive change this year.

headline.print_headline: Tech Also Did Some Good Things in 2017. No Joke.
headline.main: Some Things About Tech Were Good in 2017. No, Really.

docs.snippet: Facebook said that fake accounts and pages had bought 3,000 ads focused on divisive social issues, including race and immigration.

headline.print_headline: Fake Russian Facebook Accounts Planted $100,000 in Political Ads
headline.main: Fake Russian Facebook Accounts Bought $100,000 in Political Ads

docs.snippet: Two Times tech reporters discuss the week’s events and developments in Silicon Valley, including a certain Apple iPhone event.

headline.print_headline: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: iPhones and Facebook
headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: New iPhones and Facebook Ads

docs.snippet: In a letter to Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg, Representative Robin Kelly demanded that he take seriously Russian efforts to exploit racial division.

headline.print_headline: Black Lawmakers Pressure Facebook Over Racially Divisive Russian Ads
headline.main: Black Lawmakers Pressure Facebook Over Racially Divisive Russian Ads
